description.title: rear axle components : precautions for the repair

descmetadata.siename: rear axle components : precautions for the repair

description.title: Advice to be followed before any operation

descbody.para: If a lift must be used for an operation, observe the safety instructions vehicle : towing and liftingGIEMR-002447.

description.title: Instructions to be followed during the operation

descbody.para: Do not press on the brake pedal during work on the brake system.
If, during work on the brake system, any damage on any part is observed, it must be repaired before driving the vehicle again.
Brake fluid is highly corrosive. Ensure any brake fluid spilt on parts of the vehicle is cleaned off.
In case of incorrect handling, the brake fluid can cause serious injury and damage. Follow the manufacturer's instructions for brake fluid.

description.title: Advice to be followed before any operation

descbody.para: Protect any bodywork components that risk being damaged by brake fluid with a cover.

description.title: Instructions to be followed during the operation

descbody.para: Clean around the braking system using brake cleaner vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445.

noteR.para: Prepare for the flow of fluid, and protect the surrounding components.

descbody.para: Do not allow friction materials to come into contact with grease, oil or other lubricants and cleaning products which are mineral oil based.
When replacing brake pads, be sure to replace the pads on the opposite side.
When replacing a disc, always replace the disc on the opposite side.
When replacing brake discs, you must replace the brake pads.

noteR.para: To avoid damaging the parking brake cable protectors and causing premature wear to the system, do not handle the cables with a tool.
To ensure that the ABS and ESP systems operate correctly, check that the underbody brake pipes are clipped in place and are not crossed.
In order not to disrupt the ESP system and cause an accident, do not swap the connection of the brake pipes and hoses.
In order not to damage the brake hose:

ul.li: check that there is no contact with the surrounding components.

noteR.para: To avoid any accident, bring the pistons, brake pads and brake discs into contact by depressing the brake pad several times.

descbody.para: It is essential to replace the rigid brake pipe clips.

noteR.para: To avoid brake imbalance, both drums must be of the same diameter. Regrinding one drum necessitates regrinding of the opposite drum.

descbody.para: It is essential to check the condition of the bearing surface and the stub-axle carrier before refitting the bearing.

noteR.para: To ensure that the wheel speed sensor works properly, do not mark the sensor target on the bearing.

descbody.para: Use surface cleaner vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445 Â to clean:

ul.li: the inner surface of the new bearing, in contact with the rear stub-axle,
the rear stub-axle surface in contact with the new bearing.

descbody.para: When replacing the spring, make sure it is positioned the right way round.
When replacing a spring, always replace the spring on the opposite side.
During assembly and removing operations, the surface and the protection paint must not be damaged.
There must be no impacts during operations. Any handling hooks and tightening or positioning clamps should be equipped with rubber or plastic in order to avoid damage on the springs.
It is recommended to replace springs if:

ul.li: there are dents on the spring.

noteR.para: To prevent the suspension spring from prematurely breaking, do not damage the anti-corrosion protection.
To prevent any damage, do not use the rear axle as support for the lifting system.

descbody.para: It is essential that the subframe and arm mountings are replaced.
Be sure to follow the subframe tightening order.
Check that the ball joint cover is present and in good condition.
No operations should be carried out on the following components:

noteR.para: To prevent the components of the rear axle from deteriorating (rubber bushes, brake hoses, etc.) do not remove the two shock absorbers at the same time. Proceed one side at a time.
